pullRequest.body:
I am keeping some `1 / p` lemmas behind to keep the diff small but the goal is to get rid of them entirely.


---

nodes.body:
as usual, please wait for CI to finish

bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

As this PR is labelled `auto-merge-after-CI`, we are now sending it to bors:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7896041208/job/21549350659)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7896041208/job/21549350873)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7896041208/job/21549351069)
These should be `protected`. Presumably the point is to use dot notation anyway, so it doesn't hurt anything.

I wanted to keep the PR focused, but I agree, so done it is!
```suggestion
protected lemma inv_pos : 0 < p⁻¹ := inv_pos.2 h.pos
protected lemma inv_nonneg : 0 ≤ p⁻¹ := h.inv_pos.le
protected lemma inv_ne_zero : p⁻¹ ≠ 0 := h.inv_pos.ne'
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Use `p⁻¹` instead of `1 / p` in conjugate exponents
